name: Entering the Ring Quiz | Wordplay for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Make a 5-letter word meaning to take with you.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Bring.

	B + Ring = Bring If you bring something, you take it with you.  For instance, if I bring a bottle of soda to a party, it's with me.  The past tense of bring is "brought".

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word for the tassels on the end of a blanket or pillow.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Fringe.

	F + Ring + E Fringe, or tassels, is the string you see on the ends of blankets or pillows.  It is also the name of a TV show.

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word that means something is not interesting.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Boring.

	Bo + Ring = Boring If something is boring, it is not very fun.  Boring can also mean drilling a hole.

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word that means you are kind and loving towards someone.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Caring.

	Ca + Ring = Caring If someone is caring, they feel concern for someone.  A caring person loves and is kind to someone else.

questions.text: Make a 5-letter word that means to squeeze the water out of something.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Wring.

	W + Ring = Wring If you squeeze a sponge out, you wring out the water.  You can also wring out a rag, a towel, or anything else that holds liquid.

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word meaning to grow weary, or to weaken over time.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Tiring.

	Ti + Ring = Tiring If you are tiring out, you are growing weary, or weakening.  If something IS tiring, it makes you tire out.

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word for a piece of thread.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
String.

	St + Ring = String A string is a small piece of yarn or thread.  String can be used to tie things together.  There are a lot of different kinds of string, even kinds called "dissolving" thread, which means it starts to disappear when it touches water.

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word that means making someone no longer sick, and also a way to flavor meat.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Curing.

	Cu + Ring = Curing Curing can mean making someone better when they are sick.  For instance, if you have a cold, drinking a lot of liquid and having plenty of rest can be called a "cure" for your cold.  Curing meat is also a way to make it taste good and keep longer.

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word for a season of the year.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Spring.

	Sp + Ring = Spring Spring is a season when the flowers start to grow, trees get their leaves back, and the grass first becomes green.  It's not as cold as fall is, and not as hot as summer.  Spring can also be a little coil device.

questions.text: Make a 6-letter word for something a boss may end up doing to an employee if they don't do a good job.  Remember, it has the word "ring" in it.
questions.explanation:
Firing.

	Fi + Ring = Firing If a boss first employs an employee, he is hiring them.  But, if he doesn't like the job that they are doing, he can be firing them.  Firing can also mean shooting a firework.
